byline: Stacey Vanek Smith, Jeff Tyler, Rob Schmitz, Sally Herships, Kai Ryssdal and Mitchell Hartman
description: Fabrice Tourre, who dubbed himself 'Fabulous Fab' back when he was a Goldman Sachs trader, goes on trial today for alleged fraud during the financial crisis. With so much alleged wrongdoing during the financial crisis, why are relatively low-level bankers the only ones in court? Plus, Google bought Frommer's travel guides only last August, but the 83-year-old founder just took back his company. And finally, Hamburger Helper is dropping the word 'hamburger' from its title -- how do you rebrand yourself when people change they way they use your product?
